What is Flux Finance? 👀

Flux Finance is a decentralized lending protocol originally built by the @OndoFinance team.

The protocol is a fork of Compound V2 with additional functionality to support permissionless (e.g. $USDC) and permissioned (e.g. $OUSG) tokens. https://t.co/v5clmPCKTq

Permissions are enforced on a per-asset basis.

For example, a $USDC lender won't have any restrictions, but a $USDC borrower using $OUSG as collateral must satisfy $OUSG's permissions.

Learn more: https://t.co/DqwYYYZxIE

3⃣ pools = 10% boost
4⃣ pools = 15% boost

What is Flux Finance? 👀

Flux Finance is a decentralized lending protocol originally built by the @OndoFinance team.

The protocol is a fork of Compound V2 with additional functionality to support both permissionless (e.g. $USDC) and permissioned (e.g. $OUSG) tokens.

Permissions are enforced on a per-asset basis.

For example, a $USDC lender won't have any restrictions, but a $USDC borrower using $OUSG as collateral will need to satisfy $OUSG's permissions.

RT @goverland_xyz: Gearbox Protocol is renowned for its easy, boundless leverage. @GearboxProtocol gives you the opportunity to access up to 10x leverage to maximize your returns. It operates through Credit Accounts, which are isolated smart contracts. These contracts combine your funds (which also serve as collateral for your leverage) with the leverage funds you obtain.

The best part is that you can use these funds across multiple DeFi protocols like @Uniswap, @eigenlayer, @CurveFinance, @LidoFinance, and more. If high-risk strategies aren't your style but you own valuable assets, you can deposit them and earn passive yield with peace of mind.

We found it delightful to read all the documentation of Gearbox. It's very well written and understandable for both passive lenders and active borrowers/leverage takers. Give it a try whether you are on one side or the other!
https://t.co/iPe9wHTwuP

Now, let's explore the governance model of Gearbox:

Did you know Gearbox Protocol has had no core team since day one? No central authority here! It’s all about the community. The DAO consists of community multisigs and hundreds of token holders.

While most DAOs started with 1 token = 1 vote, Gearbox realized from the start that this was not fair. With the core team and contributors holding more tokens, they could outweigh even a large group of DAO members. Thus, a fair distribution of voting power was introduced: core members have 1 $GEAR = 0.125 voting power, core contributors have 1 $GEAR = 0.25 voting power, and community members hold the full 1 vote per token.

Additionally, the company wallet (holding 11% of all shares) and the DAO wallet (holding 51% of all shares) do not have the right to vote on most proposals unless eligible. This ensures community voices are over 2x stronger in voting power than early contributors and initial core members combined. This prevents misuse of power and promotes a democratic decision-making process.

How to become a member? It’s as simple as joining their Discord, making friends, having conversations, and getting some $GEAR to stake for voting eligibility. Engaging actively in the community helps you gain insights and build relationships, making it easier to participate in governance.

One of our favorite aspects is the regular voting cycle for setting up Gauges, approximately every 7 days (though sometimes it can be longer). Members vote on the extra quota interest rate a borrower pays—setting up the Gauges. This creates an intriguing game theory: borrowers want lower rates, lenders want higher returns, and protocols aim to attract more borrowers. If lenders get higher returns, it can result in fewer borrowed funds. Conversely, if borrowers get lower costs, protocols will attract more borrowers, but it might reduce the number of lenders. The balance game begins and never stops!

You can participate in this voting game theory through our mobile app using your mobile wallet as @zerion or @myetherwallet to get the most out of it and never miss a round!

In conclusion, Gearbox Protocol offers a unique blend of high leverage opportunities and community-driven governance. Whether you're looking to maximize your profits through leverage or earn a passive yield with your assets, Gearbox provides the tools and community to support your goals. Join the Discord, get some $GEAR, download Goverland, get involved, and see how you can benefit from this innovative DeFi protocol.

#DeFi #YieldFarming #DAO #Governance #Decentralization #Goverlander #Goverland #GearboxProtocol #CryptoFinance

Gearbox Protocol is renowned for its easy, boundless leverage. @GearboxProtocol gives you the opportunity to access up to 10x leverage to maximize your returns. It operates through Credit Accounts, which are isolated smart contracts. These contracts combine your funds (which also serve as collateral for your leverage) with the leverage funds you obtain.

The best part is that you can use these funds across multiple DeFi protocols like @Uniswap, @eigenlayer, @CurveFinance, @LidoFinance, and more. If high-risk strategies aren't your style but you own valuable assets, you can deposit them and earn passive yield with peace of mind.

We found it delightful to read all the documentation of Gearbox. It's very well written and understandable for both passive lenders and active borrowers/leverage takers. Give it a try whether you are on one side or the other!
https://t.co/iPe9wHTwuP

Now, let's explore the governance model of Gearbox:

Did you know Gearbox Protocol has had no core team since day one? No central authority here! It’s all about the community. The DAO consists of community multisigs and hundreds of token holders.

While most DAOs started with 1 token = 1 vote, Gearbox realized from the start that this was not fair. With the core team and contributors holding more tokens, they could outweigh even a large group of DAO members. Thus, a fair distribution of voting power was introduced: core members have 1 $GEAR = 0.125 voting power, core contributors have 1 $GEAR = 0.25 voting power, and community members hold the full 1 vote per token.

Additionally, the company wallet (holding 11% of all shares) and the DAO wallet (holding 51% of all shares) do not have the right to vote on most proposals unless eligible. This ensures community voices are over 2x stronger in voting power than early contributors and initial core members combined. This prevents misuse of power and promotes a democratic decision-making process.

How to become a member? It’s as simple as joining their Discord, making friends, having conversations, and getting some $GEAR to stake for voting eligibility. Engaging actively in the community helps you gain insights and build relationships, making it easier to participate in governance.

One of our favorite aspects is the regular voting cycle for setting up Gauges, approximately every 7 days (though sometimes it can be longer). Members vote on the extra quota interest rate a borrower pays—setting up the Gauges. This creates an intriguing game theory: borrowers want lower rates, lenders want higher returns, and protocols aim to attract more borrowers. If lenders get higher returns, it can result in fewer borrowed funds. Conversely, if borrowers get lower costs, protocols will attract more borrowers, but it might reduce the number of lenders. The balance game begins and never stops!

🚨Important Update: New Cowcentrated Liquidity Management (CLM) Pools 🧵

You may have noticed a banner in your UI about unstaked CLM. This means you have #cowTokens that need to be staked into new CLM Pools to continue earning rewards. Here's what you need to know:

New Base Token: #rCowTokens are now the base token for CLMs. Your existing #cowTokens will continue to earn trading fees as before, but you may miss out on other rewards if you do not stake in the pool.

Action Required: If you're an existing CLM user, you need to stake your cowTokens into the respective CLM Pools to earn rewards and incentives from Beefy or our partners.

New Claim Tab: Find all your claimable rewards (Pool rewards, Merkle rewards, VELO, etc.) in the new Claim tab within the Deposit/Withdrawal module.

Enhanced Reward System: Beefy or approved partners can now add rewards to CLM Pools at any time. Once added, you'll start earning automatically without any extra steps beyond staking in the reward pool.

APY Breakdown: You'll see Pool Rewards, Merkle Rewards, and Trading fees clearly separated in the APY breakdown.

We're continuously working to improve your experience. If you encounter any issues or have questions, please post in ⁠💧-clm on Beefy's Discord. Thank you for being an early supporter of CLM as we continue to make DeFi easier and more optimized for everyone!
